intro: Englerophytum laurentii, commonly known as the Laurentian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically covered in fine hairs. It has adapted to survive in harsh conditions with deep roots and reduced water loss mechanisms. Botanically, it belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley.
